channel.title: Artwork in the feed [IMPORTANT for anyone remixing]
channel.description:
I've already said a million times that you NEED to actually change projects you find in the feed for them to be a remix and not plagiarism. Hopefully people should know that by now. However, people seem to think they get the full rights to the song if it's in the feed. (Spoiler alert: YOU DON'T) Guys, you have the right to upload your adaptions of people's work under the liscense their posted under, but that does NOT work if you don't actually alter the project OR EVEN USE THE ARTWORK. Even if you apply a bunch of filters on it; it is still copyrighted and you do not have the rights to use it. The artwork is not part of the project. The artwork is not for you to use. If you ask the artist, they might give it to you. But you can't just use it like that.
I'll just make it clear. YOU HAVE NO RIGHTS TO ANY ARTWORK IN THE FEED.
Thanks for your time.
(all caps is emphasis and not yelling btw. I'm not trying to rant)

item.title: Artwork in the feed [IMPORTANT for anyone remixing]
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
It’s honestly pretty surprising that this has to be made explicitly clear in a post like this. I think you said it pretty well.

If you want to use samples / artwork from a track, or upload a licensed track to any kind of channel including promotional channels, check with the creator first.

Read full topic
item.source: Artwork in the feed [IMPORTANT for anyone remixing]

item.title: Artwork in the feed [IMPORTANT for anyone remixing]
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Produk:

wait what happened now?

What always happens.

Guys, if you want to use the artwork, I’d recommend getting into contact with the creators to see if they will let you. I am very grateful to @aUstin_Haga for allowing me to utilize the official artwork for the mashup epic mix of Float, Changes and P O W I did a while back, and the same for Singularity as well (Thank you @Produk for letting me do that as well).

If you aren’t sure, then ask.

Read full topic
item.source: Artwork in the feed [IMPORTANT for anyone remixing]
